item.title: Kit add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "Man is an artifact designed for space travel. He is not designed to remain in his present biologic state any more than a tadpole is designed to remain a tadpole." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Kit add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "I don't care if people hate my guts; I assume most of them do. The important question is whether they are in a position to do anything about it." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Kit add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. A psychotic is a guy who's just found out what's going on." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Kit add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "L'éternité, c'est long ... surtout vers la fin." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Kit add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "If you're looking for sympathy you'll find it between shit and syphilis in the dictionary." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Kit add a quote by tim burton
item.description:
"But she knows she has a curse on her, a curse she cannot win. For if someone gets too close to her,
the pins stick further in." -- tim burton

item.title: Kit add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kit add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Kit add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I'd take the awe of understanding over the awe of ignorance any day." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kit add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?" -- Douglas Adams
